newsitem.title: USA: Brent crude gains ground in late US paper trading.
newsitem.headline: Brent crude gains ground in late US paper trading.

text.p: North Sea benchmark Brent crude gained ground in late U.S. paper trading on Monday in a string of partial transactions, traders said.
Partial August cargoes changed hands seven times between $17.85 and $17.91, rounding out the aftermarket at $17.87-90 a barrel.
London's International Petroleum Exchange (IPE) closed at $17.86 for August. September settled at $18.04.
July/August traded twice, once at minus 28 cents and once at minus 26 cents, ending steady at minus 26-24 cents a barrel.
August/September hovered at minus 18/16 cents a barrel, while September/October was called at minus 17/14 cents a barrel.
